entry.title: SAP Signavio Process Governance
entry.content:
Hallo zusammen,

Wir haben folgende Herausforderung.

Wir sind gerade dabei, Process Governance einzurichten und haben einen ersten Versuch zur Erstellung eines automatischen Workflows wieder gelöscht.

Leider erhalten wir seitdem täglich die folgende Meldung:

"Signavio Approval Workflow nicht gefunden"

"Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren"

bei der Überprüfung der geplanten Genehmigungen für heute ist der folgende Fehler aufgetretenDer in der Konfiguration Genehmigungsablauf konfigurierte Genehmigungsworkflow (id:..........)  ist nicht mehr vorhanden.

Ich möchte diese tägliche Benachrichtigung ausstellen, finde aber keinen Hinweis wie bzw. wo!

Dementsprechend habe ich mich entschlossen, die Community zu Fragen.

 

Im Voraus vielen Dank für die Unterstützung.

entry.title: Why does admin.eu1.gigya.com point to US1 load balancer?
entry.content:
Hello community,

today the subdomain admin.eu1.gigya.com  points to US1 load balancer.
This is the answer of the DNS:

id 39071
opcode QUERY
rcode NOERROR
flags QR RD RA
;QUESTION
admin.eu1.gigya.com. IN A
;ANSWER
admin.eu1.gigya.com. 900 IN CNAME farm5.us1.gigya.com.
farm5.us1.gigya.com. 900 IN CNAME lb-d.us1.gigya.com.
lb-d.us1.gigya.com. 30 IN A 18.210.153.8
;AUTHORITY
;ADDITIONAL

As we can see the CNAME entries are US1 and the A record points to IP 18.210.153.8, which is part of the US1 load balancer IP list:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CUSTOMER_DATA_CLOUD/8b8d6fffe113457094a17701f63e3d6a/417fcecf70b21014bbc5a10ce4041860.html

Is that correct?
Is this network configuration of SAP Customer Data Cloud  compliant with GDPR regulations?

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Movment type 101 and 103
entry.content:
As already indicated, SAP does not provide a direct configuration to map a PO document type (NB vs. ZNB) straight to an inbound-delivery type (EL vs. ZEL). The inbound-delivery type is derived from the confirmation control key (and its internal “confirmation category”), not from the purchasing document type itself. Below are your “standard” options—plus the one custom‐exit path if you truly need to lock it down by PO type.

Define Two Confirmation Control Keys;

  1. 0001 (copy of standard, for NB) and
  2. ZNB1 (for your ZNB doc type).

Assign Each Control Key a Confirmation Category → Inbound-Delivery Type

  1. Control Key 0001 → Confirmation Category LA → Delivery Type EL
  2. Control Key ZNB1 → Confirmation Category LA → Delivery Type ZEL

and finally, Link the Control Key to Each PO Doc Type

entry.title: Re: partially committed webservice-transactions in SQL Anywhere
entry.content:
One more significant detail is that I create a TEMPORARY NOT TRANSACTIONAL Table and truncate it within myproc. According to the docs "A COMMIT is performed before and after a TRUNCATE statement is executed.", but according to my experiments I think this doesnt apply for temporary and not transaction tables.

So my code looks almost like this:

create or replace table mytable (TS timestamp, msg varchar(100));
create or replace service myservice type 'xml' authorization off user dba as call myproc();
create or replace procedure myproc()
begin
declare local temporary table mytemp(col1 int) not transactional;
insert into mytable values (now(), 'Start');
truncate table mytemp;
--long processing logic replaced with waitfor
waitfor delay '00:00:20';
insert into mytable values (now(), 'End');
select 'finished' from dummy;
end;

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud leading ledger HGB
entry.content:
Hello Carolin,

Yes — the same principle still applies in the context of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition for companies using HGB (HGB = Deutsche GAAP / DEAP) as their group accounting principle.

In S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, ledger 0L is always the leading ledger. You cannot change that. But you can assign whichever accounting principle you like to it (e.g. IFRS or US‑GAAP as corporate GAAP).
As a result, you cannot designate DEAP (German HGB) as the leading ledger unless it’s the corporate standard — which would not follow SAP’s recommended pattern.
So using DEAP as the non-leading ledger is allowed — even if your group GAAP is HGB — but you must still choose IFRS or US‑GAAP as the corporate (group) principle assigned to ledger 0L, and move DEAP to a non‑leading ledger like 2L.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Sharing PO Responsibilities Between Two Company Codes (GR & Cost Split)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm exploring a business requirement involving two company codes and would appreciate your insights:

  • Company Code 1 creates a Purchase Order to a supplier.

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods (Goods Receipt) against that PO.

  • Company Code 1 is responsible for paying the material cost.

  • Company Code 2 is responsible for paying the customs/duties related to the import.

My current approach:

  • Company Code 1 issues the PO to the supplier,

  • Then an Intercompany STO is created from Company Code 1 to Company Code 2 (Free of Charge),

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods via the STO.

However, this adds complexity and time to the process.

Question:
Is there any alternative or simplified solution in SAP S/4HANA that allows:

  • Company Code 1 to issue the PO,

  • Company Code 2 to post the Goods Receipt directly against that PO,

  • And each company code to handle their respective costs (material vs. customs)?

We would appreciate any advice on configurations, custom enhancements, or standard processes that might help here.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM - Requirements workflow approval setup, and restrictions using roles
entry.content:
Hi,

We’re planning to utilize the Requirements feature in SAP Cloud ALM to support our workflow processes, and we’d like to better understand how the approval flow. Specifically if the statuses "Not Assigned", "Ready to Approve", and "Approved/Rejected" can be controlled through role-based access.

From our initial review, it appears that there are no predefined roles that directly govern approval permissions. Our intended setup is as follows:

  • Business Leads should have permission to

    • view requirements

    • change the approval status

    • not modify any other details.

  • Team Members should be able to

    • edit the scope of requirements

    • but not alter the approval status.

Could you please advise how roles can be configured to support this level of access control and separation of duties?

Regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM - Requirements workflow approval setup,...
entry.content:
The Approving Requirements and Creating Related Tasks documentation outlines that in the current behaviour of the system "Requirements can be approved by any team member. The approval is logged in the history.".

If you wish to influence the future development of SAP Cloud ALM and provide direction to our Developers in relation to this topic, please use the options outlined in this KBA:
3391676 - SAP Continuous Influence for SAP Cloud ALM

An existing idea related to this topic already exists - CALM for Implementation - Requirement to Deployment Strict Workflow with compliance
To show your support, add a vote and a comment to express how this idea will contribute to meeting some of your desired behaviours.
If this idea does not match the behaviours, please create a new one and capture the full context of what you desire.

If specific functionality is demanded by Customers through the official channels then it will communicate clearly to our Developers that a topic needs to be considered and planned for.
This will trigger internal discussions and potentially add this as a backlog item in the internal infrastructure for development planning.
Once those discussions move forward, an entry is usually made in the Customer facing Roadmap for SAP Cloud ALM.

hi, 
first groovy code (Tip 1)may need to be amended as it won't work on (now available) Postgresql DB

 

String func_length, func_currDate;
if(Config.getParameter("db.driver").contains("Oracle")){//oracle
  println "processing for Oracle"
    func_length="length";
    func_currDate="sysdate";
} else if(Config.getParameter("db.driver").contains("sqlserver")){//azure
	println "processing for Azure"
    func_length="datalength";
    func_currDate="getDate()";
} else if (Config.getParameter("db.driver").toLowerCase().contains("postgresql")) {//postgresql
    println "processing for PostgreSQL"
    func_length = "length";
    func_currDate = "current_timestamp";
}

entry.title: Re: Does "Insurance Values" exist in FI/AA - SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hi Carolin,

Yes — it is still true that insurance values within FI‑AA (Fixed Asset Accounting) are not available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition in the same way as on-premise systems. That limitation remains unchanged.

-You cannot maintain insurance values in the asset master record (e.g. ANLV, insurance company, insurance rate fields) in Public Cloud.
-Custom or customer-owned depreciation areas—which on-premise systems could use to manage insurance valuations—are not supported in Public Cloud.
-Therefore, the tab and fields previously available in the asset master for insurance are no longer present.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: How to plan long lead time ROH materials for WBS Projects
entry.content:
Current practise
In some sites these long lead time ROH materials are not added to Planned orders or BOM Components, rather PIR are created against these materials and Purchase requisitions are created via MRP. But here the problem is the PIR's need to be reviewes on regular basis and reorganized. Business need to automate this.
You may ask why PR not created directly, because as there will be no relation with the requirements or project. 

Points to be considered while planning these materials (ROH) against the project WBS.

Demand data of these materials will not be defined on initial stage, but will be defined during product design based on project.
Lead time of these materials are high and varies with each. So, procurement take a long time. (can we add gr processing time)
Cost of the materials are high. So, purchase will be made only after customer confirmation. (Can we create purchase order directly with release strategy. If yes how to automate it like PR creation by MRP. How to link it to requirement)
Approximately 10 – 20 new materials will be created for a project. No Similarities (40 – 100 Materials / Project).

entry.title: Re: Intermittent Error While Opening WWI Report in CG54
entry.content:
Hello Christoph,

Thanks for waiting on this one. I was awaiting a reply from SAP.  I did spent sometime trying to find out the root cause and ultimately there was no exact cause known. But the WWI report we released in Feb 2025 somehow was the starting point. In order to fix the issue I did not create a copy of earlier version and made the changes. But instead I opened a new WWI report and then copied the changes. This worked. I released the WWI report and released SDS and then we no longer faced this issue.

I wrote a ticket to SAP thinking may be this has anything to do with WWI SP 65 or 67 release. But this was never confirmed.

SAP also suggested the same thing today morning.

Dear Rohan Somji,

Thank you for all the information provided and pardon for the delay on my response.

After analyzing your scenario, We suspect that the document was corrupted when saving in Word.
Unfortunately, we can no longer identify the cause.

Our suggestion would be to copy the contents of this template into a new template. This also corresponds to the message Word displays when opening it.


Regards,

Rohan Somji

entry.title: Re: Sharing PO Responsibilities Between Two Company Codes...
entry.content:
You want Company Code 1 (CC1) to issue a single PO, have Company Code 2 (CC2) post the Goods Receipt (GR) against that PO, let CC1 pay for the material and CC2 pick up customs/duties—without the overhead of an intercompany STO.

Here are three viable routes in SAP S/4HANA:

Two-Step Goods Movement (No STO Master)
CC1 creates a standard PO for Plant A (in CC1). CC1 performs MIGO GR (101) against that PO → inventory arrives in Plant A under CC1. Immediately post a plant‐to‐plant transfer (MIGO movement 301) from Plant A (CC1) to Plant B (CC2). CC1 pays the supplier invoice against the original PO. CC2 creates a separate service PO (or manual invoice) to cover customs/duties and pays that bill.

Benefits

  • No STO master or intercompany billing.
  • Simple “two MIGO” flow.

Drawbacks

  • Extra movement posting (301) and associated FI cross‐CC clearing.
  • Slight delay in having goods physically in CC2’s plant.

Central Procurement (Shared-Service Hub)
Leverage SAP’s Central Procurement scenario so that a central purchasing org (in CC1) issues the PO, but the receiving plant belongs to CC2. That is assign one Purchasing Organizational Unit to CC1 (the “hub”). In the PO item, you specify Plant in CC2 (allowed under Central Procurement customizing). GR (MIGO 101) posts in CC2’s valuation area → inventory in Plant B/CC2. Invoice Verification (MIRO) still against the PO’s company code (CC1) → CC1 pays material cost. CC2 handles customs/duties via a local service PO or customs‐broker invoice.

Benefits

  • Single PO, single GR transaction, no plant‐to‐plant movement.
  • Standard “Procurement Hub” pattern in S/4HANA.

Drawbacks

  • Requires activation/config of Central Procurement (SAP Note-based).
  • Invoice entry must happen in CC1 (user training).

Split Invoices with Separate POs
If the vendor can split their billing, you can leave the GR on CC2’s PO and drive costs separately. That is CC1 issues a Material PO (NB) to the vendor for the product, with Plant B in CC2 (requires central procurement or cross‐CC master data tweak). Upon delivery, CC2 does MIGO GR (101) against that PO → inventory in CC2. Vendor sends two invoices - Invoice #1 (material only) processed in CC1 → material cost hits CC1 and Invoice #2 (customs/duties) processed in CC2 → duty cost hits CC2.

Benefits

  • Each company code posts only the invoice they care about.
  • No intercompany stock movements.

Drawbacks

  • Vendor must issue dual invoices or you need a customs‐broker PO in CC2.
  • PO header/company‐code vs. plant‐assignment can get tricky—central procurement helps.

entry.title: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlement Management
entry.content:
XYZ is Kitchen equipment Retailer. Their business runs on SAP S/4 2023. Business pay Royalties to designer based on customer billing value. The agreement is to have Royalties rate based on cumulative billing value. This rate is applied on monthly billing value.

 

Historical sales = £50k

Agreed tier with partner

 

From

To

Rate

£1k

£100k

4%

£101k

£150k

3%

 

 

 

July

Aug

Sep

Monthly sales vol

£40k

£30k

£20k

**bleep** Sales value

£90k

£120k

£140k

Rate applicable

4%

3%

3%

Royalties accrual

£1.6k

£1k

£0.6k

 

Quarterly royalties payment (First week of October) = £1.6k + £1k + £0.6k = £3.2k

 

We would like to enable Royalties settlement management solution in SAP S/4.

entry.title: Strategic guidelines for data integration with SAP Signavio Process Intelligence and SAP BTP
entry.content:
A unified approach to process data integration 

Did you know that 80% of the effort in data projects is spent not on analysis, but on preparing and integrating the data? This well-known industry statistic highlights a hard truth: even the best tools can’t deliver insights without the right data plumbing. 

In today’s complex and interconnected enterprise IT landscape, unlocking value at scale from process data requires a flexible and scalable data integration strategy, that aligns with business architecture, IT policy, and transformation goals.  

At SAP Signavio, we see process, people, applications, and data as the core ingredients for driving operational excellence and business transformation. Combined, they make it possible to get fast time to insights as you form your business strategy, and fast time to adapt as you execute against it. 

Enterprise IT landscapes are highly fragmented, with critical process data scattered across ERP systems, cloud applications, data lakes, and external platforms. Many process mining initiatives struggle not just because integration is complex, but also because companies rely on tools that happen to include data integration capabilities, rather than adopting solutions purpose-built for scalable and governed data integration. This leads to bottlenecks, high costs, and missed expectations. 

To address this challenge, SAP Signavio is strengthening its integration capabilities with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), enabling you to seamlessly connect, manage, and analyze process data across SAP and non-SAP systems. 

In this blog post, we share our strategic direction for data connectivity in SAP Signavio, highlight recent enhancements, and provide practical guidance on when to use which option. 

 

SAP ERP Connectivity – options and guidance 

SAP ERP systems (SAP ECC and SAP S/4HANA) have become a more foundational source of critical process data than ever, playing a pivotal role in powering process insights. SAP Signavio offers multiple data integration paths depending on your goals, data landscape, and architecture maturity. 

 

Plug and gain: fast time-to-insight 

We continue to support the plug and gain approach, designed for fast value realization. You connect your systems and gain immediate process insights – often within hours. 

This approach leverages the SAP Signavio Process Insights connector within SAP Signavio Process Intelligence for quick access to prebuilt process KPIs, execution variants, benchmarks, and recommendations across major ERP processes. 

Only the data you need is extracted – automatically and semantically enriched using over 50 years of SAP domain expertise. This ensures relevance, speed, and minimal extraction effort. 

 

When should you use it? 

  • You want fast, no-code setup and instant value 
  • You’re focused on diagnostics, benchmarks, or best-practice guidance 
  • You don’t yet need raw data for custom process mining 

 

📚Learn more: 

  • Strategic overview of plug and gain 
  • Technical guide 

 

SAP RFC connector: table extraction for deep analysis 

The SAP RFC connector is today the primary option to directly connect SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to on-premise SAP ERP systems, enabling table-level extraction, and providing full flexibility in data modelling to build the event log for process mining from raw data.  

With the release of Automatic Pagination (November 2024) and further enhancements in 2025, the SAP RFC connector now provides a unified and streamlined user experience for most extraction scenarios – greatly reducing the need for the advanced extraction interface (see here for specific use cases where it’s still required). At the same time, performance and scalability have been significantly improved to better support enterprise-scale data volumes. 

 

When should you use it? 

  • You want to define your own data selection criteria 
  • You want full control over data extraction and event log construction 
  • You require full flexibility to define your own joins, filters, and event log logic 

 

SAP Datasphere replication flows: the strategic path forward 

As part of SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Datasphere replication flows represent a strategic evolution in how SAP Signavio integrates with SAP ERP systems.  

They offer near-real time data updates, enterprise-grade data replication, helping customers simplify complex data landscapes while increasing reliability, scalability, and governance. 

Replication flows in SAP Datasphere operate through a pass-through architecture (no intermediate storage), leveraging database triggers and logging tables, Change Data Capture (CDC) for delta handling, and SAP Cloud Connector for secure connectivity from on-prem systems. 

This integration is now available via beta programs. It is entering general availability (GA planned for September 2025) and is the recommended path forward for scalable, cloud-native data connectivity in process mining use cases. 

Looking ahead, we plan to further deepen our integration with SAP Datasphere by exchanging data products. SAP Signavio is expected to act as both a consumer – leveraging SAP-provided data products (e.g., from SAP S/4HANA or SAP Ariba) to even further simplify ETL efforts – and a producer, exposing process analytics as reusable data products for broader consumption across the enterprise.  

 

When should you use it? 

  • You are aligning with your existing SAP-based data architecture 
  • You are dealing with very large enterprise data volumes 
  • You require near-real time and robust data updates 

 

🎯Stay tuned for a deep dive blog post, and for an end-to-end setup guide and architecture overview coming soon! 

 

Connectivity for SAP public cloud & enterprise applications 

SAP Signavio offers point-to-point native connectors for direct data replication from: 

  • SAP public cloud applications like SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Sales & Service Cloud, SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP), and SAP Digital Manufacturing 
  • On-prem enterprise applications like JIRA and Service Now. 

 

When should you use it? 

  • You want direct, low-overhead connectivity without middleware 
  • Your application is supported by a native SAP Signavio connector. Find the list here 

 

API-Based Connectivity: SAP Integration Suite & Business Accelerators 

SAP Integration Suite is SAP’s market leading enterprise integration platform, and the recommended solution to establish API-based connectivity with SAP Signavio – especially for non-SAP public cloud applications or for SAP public cloud applications not supported by native connectors (e.g., SAP Ariba). 

SAP Integration Suite provides standard integration packages via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub in the form of prebuilt integration flows (iFlows) to reduce the time and effort required to establish data connectivity to SAP Signavio. Current supported systems include: 

  • Salesforce 
  • Microsoft Dynamics 
  • Coupa 
  • Workday 
  • SAP Ariba 

In addition, SAP Signavio offers accelerator content on top of the standard integration packages, such as source-to-pay value accelerator for SAP Ariba, and lead-to-quote value accelerator for non-SAP CRM systems.

 

When should you use it? 

  • Your source system exposes public REST or OData APIs 
  • You want to benefit from prebuilt, extensible iFlows that accelerate integration setup 

 

📌Want to set up API-based integration? Check out our existing blog post on configuring SAP Integration Suite with SAP Signavio. 

 

Databases, data lakes & data warehouses 

For organizations with a centralized data platform, SAP Signavio offers indirect connectivity through native connectors. This includes: 

  • SAP HANA (on-prem or cloud) 
  • Google BigQuery 
  • Azure Synapse & Data Lake 
  • AWS S3 & Athena 
  • Snowflake, PostgreSQL, and others 

This approach allows you to leverage existing data architectures, ensuring compliance with enterprise-wide integration and storage policies, and capitalizing on past investments. 

 

When should you use it? 

  • You already consolidate process data in a central store 
  • Your integration landscape is based on a data lake or a data warehouse architecture 

 

Note on SAP Datasphere 
While SAP Datasphere replication flows are covered above for the use case of replicating data from SAP ERP systems, SAP Datasphere can also be used for data warehousing, consolidating and modelling process data across SAP and non-SAP sources. In this context, SAP Signavio can connect to Datasphere through standard connectors, enabling indirect connectivity via modelled, curated data sets. 

For more information, you can access the dedicated SAP mission: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missiondetail/4530/4818/  

 

Bring your own data: SAP Signavio Ingestion API 

For unique architectural needs, the public SAP Signavio Ingestion API enables customers to easily integrate with their data management tools.  

 

When should you use it? 

  • You want to bring your own data integration tools 
  • You want to ingest process data directly into SAP Signavio 
  • SAP Signavio native connectors do not fit your needs 

 

For more information about the Ingestion API, read here. 

 

Conclusion: a scalable future for data-driven Process Intelligence 

Data integration isn’t a one-size-fits-all challenge. As organizations scale their process mining initiatives, success hinges on aligning data strategy with architecture, governance, and transformation goals. Complex landscapes demand integration options that are both flexible and enterprise-ready. 

Whether your priority is out-of-the-box speed or architectural control, SAP Signavio and SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) offer a scalable, future-proof foundation for process data integration. 

As we continue to evolve our data integration capabilities, our focus remains clear: reduce complexity, increase scalability, and empower our customers to drive transformation with trusted and up-to-date process data. 

By leveraging SAP Signavio native connectors and our seamless integration with SAP Datasphere and SAP Integration Suite, organizations can make process data more accessible, more reliable, and more actionable – unlocking the full potential of process mining, and maximizing the value of their business transformation initiatives. 

 

Next Steps 

🔜Look out for our upcoming blog post on SAP Datasphere replication flow setup with SAP Signavio 

📌Check the existing Integration Suite and plug & gain content linked above 

💬Have questions or want to share your use case? Let us know in the comments

entry.title: Re: Need function module suggestion for copying archive f...
entry.content:
Hi Praveen,

The fastest and most cost-effective way (esp. if you're in a cloud environment where network egress is chargeable) is to add the Azure storage device to IXOS Archiving (OpenText Archive Server / Archive Center), attach the Azure device to the repository, and migrate from existing volumes to the new device.  Don't forget to also make the Azure storage device the default device once you're satisfied with testing and migration.  If it's an older IXOS Archiving instance, you might want to consider upgrading the software first.

Cheers,

Danai Sae-Han

entry.title: Business Builders: Narrativa Visual de Datos con SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Sobre Business Builders

Enfoque académico

  • Conceptos de narrativa y visualización de datos.
  • Desarrollo de pensamiento analítico.
  • Uso de herramientas de inteligencia empresarial (BI).
  • Gestion de grandes conjuntos de datos y técnicas de visualización para extraer información empresarial.
  • Equilibrio entre el uso de la Inteligencia Humana y la Inteligencia Artificial.
  • Familiarización a la plataforma integral de BI, planificación y análisis predictivo de SAP (SAP Analytics Cloud).
  • Enfrentar desafíos (escenarios de negocios) a través de juegos serios (gamificación).
  • Desarrollo de habilidades de toma de decisiones de primer nivel.

Objetivo pedagógico

En un mundo académico dominado por la IA generativa, los profesores deben encontrar formas creativas para cultivar las habilidades analíticas y el pensamiento crítico de los estudiantes, sin depender de máquinas que piensen por ellos para la resolución de problemas.

Los juegos serios y las simulaciones empresariales pueden ser útiles para facilitar el desarrollo de habilidades analíticas y estratégicas de los estudiantes. A través de escenarios de negocios, las simulaciones ofrecen herramientas de aprendizaje experiencial.

Temario

Día 1:

Preámbulo:

  • La revolución de la IA y la educación
  • Pensamiento analítico, crítico y estratégico
  • El poder de las simulaciones empresariales

Introducción a Business Builders (BB):

  • Cuenta educador y acceso a la plataforma.
  • Curso de autoformación.
  • Material pedagógico.
  • Escenarios empresariales.
  • Creación de grupos y manejo de juegos
  • Juguemos el escenario “Maple”

Día 2:

Juego BB con visualizaciones prediseñadas: “Business Fundamentals”

Juego BB con visualizaciones prediseñadas: “Sports Management”

Juego BB creando sus propias visualizaciones: “International Expansion”

Día 3:

Juego BB creando sus propias visualizaciones: “Supply Chain Resilience”

Juego BB creando sus propias visualizaciones: “Sustainability Portfolio”

 

Formato: 6 horas (3 días x 2 horas por día)

Fecha de inicio: Martes 2 de septiembre de 2025

Fecha de término: Jueves 4 de septiembre de 2025

Horario: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM (Hora en México)

Modalidad: Virtual, via zoom

Conocimientos previos: Conocimientos de base en visualización de datos.

Idioma: Español

Número máximo de participantes: N/A

Nombre del instructor:  Sergio De La Cruz - sergio.de-la-cruz@hec.ca

Organización: HEC Montréal - ERPsim Lab

Perfil del instructor

Impulsado por una pasión por la tecnología educativa, Sergio De La Cruz capacita a profesores de todo el mundo en el uso de las simulaciones basadas en SAP y desarrolladas por HEC Montréal-ERPsim Lab. Con una trayectoria profesional de más de 30 años en la industria, Sergio combina una sólida formación académica — MBA de HEC Montréal en Canadá, Maestría en Ciencias de ENPC en Francia, diploma de ingeniero del Tecnológico de Monterrey en México— con una comprensión integral de las disciplinas empresariales y tecnológicas. Esta combinación única le permite ofrecer un asesoramiento estratégico y eficaz en la integración curricular para que los profesores pueden maximizar el potencial de la gamificación, transformando la experiencia de aprendizaje en sus cursos.

 

Requerimiento para participar

- Este entrenamiento está específicamente diseñado para profesores y es requisito indispensable registrarse con email académico para que el registro tenga validez, vía este enlace

- El registro académico está abierto para todos los académicos, independientemente si son parte de SAP University Alliances o no, ya que BB está abierto a todo el público de profesores del mundo (y para sus estudiantes).

entry.title: Block privileges to modify the Status field of the OBTN
entry.content:
Hi,

We created a validation to block privileges to modify the Status field of the OBTN table for some users, but the validation does not run. Could you help us?

Procedure: SBO_SP_04_Maestro_Lotes

IF (:object_type = '10000044') THEN
SELECT (SELECT T0."Status" -- Load the batch status number
FROM "OBTN" T0 
WHERE T0."AbsEntry" = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del) INTO temp_var_1 FROM DUMMY;
 
SELECT (SELECT T0."UserSign"  -- Load which user made the update
FROM "OBTN" T0 
WHERE T0."AbsEntry" = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del) INTO temp_var_2 FROM DUMMY;
 
SELECT (SELECT T0."ItemCode" 
FROM "OBTN" T0 
WHERE T0."AbsEntry" = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del) INTO temp_var_3 FROM DUMMY;
 
SELECT (SELECT Top 1 T0."Status" -- Loads the value of the status field, obtained from the audit table..
FROM "ABTN" T0 
WHERE T0."ItemCode" = :temp_var_3
And T0."ObjType"  = '10000044'
ORDER BY T0."LogInstanc" DESC) INTO temp_var_4 FROM DUMMY;
 
IF :temp_var_2 <> 28 THEN -- Asks if the update is done by a different user than user XX
IF :temp_var_1 <> :temp_var_4 THEN --  Asks if the batch status data has changed, if true
temp_var_0 := 'X'; -- the variable temp_var_0 takes the value 'B'
END IF;
END IF;
 
IF :temp_var_0 = 'X' THEN -- If the variable temp_var_0 is different from '' it generates the error.
SELECT 10 INTO error FROM DUMMY;
SELECT n'...The status of the batch cannot be changed. ...' || :temp_var_1 INTO error_message FROM DUMMY;
End IF;
 
END IF;
 
--Select the return values
Select :error, :error_message FROM dummy;
End;
 
Procedure: TransactionNotification
If (object_type = '10000044') then
CALL SBO_SP_04_Maestro_Lotes(object_type,transaction_type,num_of_cols_in_key,list_of_key_cols_tab_del,list_of_cols_val_tab_del,error,error_message);
End IF;
 
Best regards!

entry.title: Re: Display String function not working in CR 2025
entry.content:
Yeah, that definitely sounds frustrating — especially since you’ve done this same thing countless times in CR 2013 without issues.

What you’re describing — entering a formula in the Display String, seeing the red X2 button indicating it saved, but then it disappears after closing — isn’t how it’s supposed to behave. In fact, that’s been a pretty consistent workflow in Crystal Reports for years.

A few thoughts that might help:

1. Known Bug or UI Glitch in CR 2025?

This honestly sounds like it could be a bug or regression in CR 2025 (since it's still fairly new). Especially if everything looks like it saved but then just vanishes — classic UI glitch behavior. SAP has had similar issues crop up in past versions.

2. Try This as a Test:

Instead of using {Command.STATUS} directly in the Display String formula, try wrapping it in a separate Formula Field first, like:

// @StatusText
'Part Status: ' + {Command.STATUS}

Then place @StatusText on your report instead and see if the formatting "sticks." It’s not a fix, but it might confirm that the issue is specific to the formatting formula UI.

3. Is the Field Suppressed or Overlapping?

Just in case — double check that:

  • The original formula field isn’t being suppressed or covered by another object.

  • There aren’t any conditional formats overriding your Display String.

4. Admin Rights / Read-Only File?

Also worth checking: Are you working in a report file that’s read-only or saved in a protected location? Sometimes if Crystal can’t save changes to the file, weird stuff like this happens — it looks like it saved, but then the changes are silently discarded.

5. Try a New Blank Report

Sometimes old reports brought into newer versions of CR don’t play nicely. Try creating a completely new report in CR 2025, drop in the same data field, and test the Display String formula there. If it works fine in the new one, you may be dealing with some weird backward-compatibility issue.

TL;DR:

No, you’re not doing anything wrong — this is a basic function that should just work. It could very well be a CR 2025 bug or glitch, especially if it’s not saving formulas consistently. Try testing it in a fresh report and/or using a separate formula field to get around it for now.

Let me know how it goes — happy to help troubleshoot further if it keeps acting up.

entry.title: Re: S4 Public cloud - invoice and cancelled invoice are s...

entry.title: Re: How to get the API Key for S4 HANA Cloud trial (Not f...
entry.content:
Hi ABC1231231

As I understand you want to use the Business Accelerator Hub Try It Out feature with your own system.

To do this, you should make sure you are logged into the Business Accelerator Hub with your SAP ID.

Access the API you want to test (for example, the Sales Order (A2X) https://api.sap.com/api/CE_SALESORDER_0001/tryout)

Select the Try Out tab, then next to the Operation, there is a drop down to Select Environment

Select "+ Add New Environment".

Here you will define a name for your system and enter the details for your system, as you have defined (exposed) them in the Communication Arrangements App in you S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system for Authentication, etc.

Example from Communication Arrangements app:

This is further documented from the Help link (find the link to the help by scrolling down to the bottom of the Business Accelerator Hub).

Direct link to Try Out: https://help.sap.com/docs/business-accelerator-hub/sap-business-accelerator-hub/trying-out-apis?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

Also: Trying Out APIs in a Configured Environment

For the various authentication methods available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, please see the help

Authentication Methods

additional information can be found in the help at Communication Management

If you are wanting to consume the APIs you have exposed in a custom app (i.e. Side By Side extensibility) on BTP, for example, you would need to utilize the Destination Service, as outlined in the BTP Help.

I hope this helps

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Re: How to plan long lead time ROH materials for WBS Proj...
entry.content:
Use PIR to capture early, design-stage demand against each WBS element. Transaction MD61 or Fiori Manage Planned Independent Requirements. Account-assign each PIR to your Project’s WBS element (Account Assignment = PS in the MD61 header). Maintain Lead Time in the material master’s MRP2 view to reflect the high, variable procurement times. That is Planned Delivery Time + GR Processing Time = Total lead time SAP uses to time your PO release date spot-on.

To prevent stale forecasts piling up, use Variant for MD74 (Reorganize PIR) which contains Key Date = Dynamic (e.g., Today + 7 days) and Delete flag for “Unconsumed PIR beyond Key Date”. Run program RM60RR20 (MD74) weekly or daily. Ensures only “live” design-stage PIR remain in the system.

Run MRP (MD02/MD03 or Fiori Schedule Jobs for MRP) for your project plant. MRP Type, Lot Size, and MRP Area scoped to only pick up your WBS-accounted materials. MRP generates PRs for each PIR line—these PRs inherit the PS-WBS account assignment automatically. Monitor PRs in Fiori app Manage Purchase Requisitions (filter by your WBS elements).

Use your WBS element, PR value threshold, or a custom “Customer Approved?” indicator as a release criterion. Workflow would be Customer or Project Lead signs off PR. PR status flips to “Released”

Schedule automatic PO creation via ME59N with a variant that selects only PRs with Release Indicator = “Approved”. Converts them to POs in bulk, carrying over the WBS element. Schedule via SM36 immediately after your MRP job (chain jobs for zero manual touch). E-mail or print the POs to vendors automatically.

End users post GR (MIGO 101) directly against the PO in Plant B. Inventory and material cost land in CC2’s plant/WBS as intended. For Custom duties, you can consider the below options:

Option A: Capture via Separate Service PO to CC2 (for duty broker)
Option B: Use LE‐FTP or customs import functionality to post duties directly to CC2’s WBS

entry.title: Re: Adding a Swagger UI to Your SAP Cloud Application Programming Model / Node.js Application
entry.content: You must already have an application router in your project if your services in the same project are projected by authentication.  Just add a router in the xs-app.json of the application router to cover the Swagger UI end point with the same security.  The user will get authenticated to access Swagger and then the same auth token will passed through to the backend service calls.

entry.title: Re: I need to create storage bins and want to use LS10, b...
entry.content:
Hello @AmberlyP 

That is how it is supposed to work. You don't change bin structure definitions in /SCWM/LS10. That is done in SPRO SCM Extended Warehouse Management -> Extended Warehouse Management -> Master Data -> Storage Bins -> Define Storage Bin Structure

Double click on a line in /SCWM/LS10. The line details will be displayed along with the option to create bins:

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Summertime = time to relax? Not for us.
entry.content:
“We?” – That's right. For a few weeks now, there have been two of us on the group's organizing team. I, Eric, am very excited to be developing the community group together with Robby and to be able to contribute my enthusiasm for SAP and the exchange of experiences.


Yesterday, the time had finally come: Robby and I were able to meet in person for the first time, with a fantastic view of the Berlin rooftops, to compare ideas and plans for the community group and discuss the first concrete activities. Be sure to mark the fourth quarter in your calendars and stay tuned!


Until then, we will use the time to grow the community with more members. Feel free to join in and share the community in your network!
We look forward to the next steps and to picking up speed together with you.

Best regards,
Eric

Sommerzeit = Zeit für Entspannung? Nicht mit uns.

Wir nutzen das trübe Berliner Sommerwetter von heute, um die Themen von morgen zu planen

„Wir?“ – richtig. Seit ein paar Wochen sind wir bereits zu zweit im Orga-Team der Gruppe. Ich, Eric, freue mich sehr, die Community-Gruppe zusammen mit Robby entwickeln und dabei meine Begeisterung für SAP und den Erfahrungsaustausch einbringen zu können.

Gestern war es endlich so weit: Robby und ich konnten bei traumhaftem Blick auf die Berliner Dächer erstmalig persönlich die Ideen und Pläne für die Community Gruppe abgleichen und die ersten konkreten Aktivitäten besprechen. Merkt euch auf jeden Fall schon einmal das vierte Quartal vor.

Bis dahin nutzen wir die Zeit, die Community um weitere Mitglieder wachsen zu lassen. Macht gern mit und teilt die Community in eurem Netzwerk!

Wir freuen uns auf die nächsten Schritte und gemeinsam mit euch Fahrt aufzunehmen.

Beste Grüße,
Eric

entry.title: Re: Unable to see list data when I run the app
entry.content:
Hello @Ankita_Mundhra 

Thanks for getting back to me. Unfortunately, we can only communicate via this portal

If everything is configured as discussed, but the data still isn't showing, let’s narrow it down:

    Confirm that the data is loading correctly

  • Add a temporary text component on the page and bind it to:

{{ JSON.stringify(yourDataVariable) }}

This will show exactly what’s coming into the variable at runtime.

Check the structure you're binding to

  • For example, if your variable returns an array under records, then you should bind the list to:

    yourDataVariable.records

    instead of just yourDataVariable.

    Is the list/table repeating content?

    Make sure your list or table is set to repeat with the correct part of the variable (e.g., yourDataVariable.records or yourDataVariable.data, depending on your API response).

    Use debugger/alerts for testing

    Add a page-mounted alert or console log to confirm if the variable contains any data on load.

If you’d like, feel free to share a screenshot of the data structure or your logic setup. I will be happy to take a quick look.

Looking forward to helping you solve this!

SAP Community,
https://community.sap.com/t5/archived-posts/rmk-can-header-be-modified/m-p/109826

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Compatibility Scope: What Happens after 2025/2030
entry.content:
Dear Prinya,
technically, a conversion from SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA (on premise) or SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition will not be different. However, beside that use rights of compatibility packages only expire in 2030 for customers with RISE with SAP or SAP Cloud ERP Private agreement, available alternatives might be different. Please refer to the spreadsheet "S4HANA CompScope - Way Forward - Info" for details.

Best regards,
Stefan

entry.title: Re: SAP ByD. Customer Invoicing - Invoice Documents: add...
entry.content:
Hello @KCPN 

The Description field cannot be added to the Invoice Documents view via Personalisation or Adaptation; this is a known limitation in SAP Business ByDesign.

You can still:

  • Add it to the printed invoice by editing the form in Form Template Maintenance
  • Use it in a custom report via the CustomerInvoice data source

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: how to configure different GL accounts for different...
entry.content:
Hello @Divyamalla ,

SAP does not allow OBYC to differentiate by movement type for WRX postings. The WRX account assignment is based on:

-Valuation class
-Chart of accounts
-Transaction key (WRX)
-Plant valuation area (if split valuation active)

Movement type (101, 102, etc.) is not part of OBYC’s key for WRX.

Workarounds:-

Option 1: Use Account Modifier in WRX (if available via BADI)

Standard SAP doesn’t provide account modifier for WRX like it does for some other keys (e.g., BSX).
But you can implement BAdI MB_ACCOUNTING_INTERFACE to dynamically change the account modifier or even the account based on the movement type.

Steps:
Implement BAdI MB_ACCOUNTING_INTERFACE or enhancement spot BADI_AC_DOCUMENT.
In the code, read the movement type (MKPF-BWART or MSEG-BWART).
Based on BWART (101/102), assign a different account modifier.
In OBYC, configure WRX for different combinations using your new account modifiers.

Option 2: Post to Same G/L but Use Different Document Type or Text for Reporting

If your only need is reporting or analysis, not actual G/L separation:
Let WRX always post to the same G/L account.

Differentiate GR and GR reversal using:
-Movement type in material document
-Document type or reference in FI document
-Custom field/text via BAdI

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlemen...
entry.content:
Hi @sumit_chourasia1 

Thank you for sharing the business scenario for XYZ, the kitchen equipment retailer. Although it is not clear if you have a question on how to achieve your target or you just made a statement. My assumption is you trying to understand if S/4HANA Settlement Management can support a royalty calculation model based on cumulative business volume, with tiered royalty rates applied monthly, and quarterly settlement payments.

If that is the case, here is what I suggest:

  • Use Condition Contracts in Settlement Management to define cumulative sales volumes as the scale basis.
  • Configure scale-based royalties using the cumulative billing value as the reference.
  • Settlement runs can be executed monthly for accruals and quarterly for payouts, aligning with your model (£3.2k for the quarter in your example).
  • Historical sales (£50k) can be considered using initial load values or adjusted accumulators in the agreement setup.

I hope these steps provides clarity. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlemen...
entry.content:
Hi @sumit_chourasia1,

This looks like a condition contract with a validity of one year, quarterly partial settlements and monthly delta accruals. It is important that within "Specify Settlement Settings for Condition Contract Types" the "Partial Settlement Type" is set to "1 Cumulative". See the F1 help for an example.

The scales from your example look like "Graduated-to interval scales". SAP offers this type of scale, but not in combination with condition contracts. See 2678613 - Using Graduated-to interval scales in Condition Contracts - SAP for Me. A solution is possible. A custom pricing formula is required. I have seen solutions for "Graduated-to interval scales" at 2 clients. 

Regards,
Michael

This information would be very helpful for internal communication and for responding to client inquiries.

entry.title: Re: SAP Signavio Process Governance
entry.content:
Hallo @Sascha_Fissel 

Danke für die Frage.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass die tägliche Fehlermeldung entsteht, weil ein geplanter Genehmigungsprozess weiterhin auf einen Workflow verweist, der inzwischen gelöscht wurde.

Um die Benachrichtigung zu stoppen, schlage ich folgedes vor:

  1. Öffnen Sie Signavio Process Governance.
  2. Navigieren Sie zu Geplante Auslöser oder „Workflows.
  3. Suchen Sie den Eintrag, der sich auf den gelöschten Workflow (ID siehe Fehlermeldung) bezieht.
  4. Deaktivieren oder löschen Sie den entsprechenden Eintrag.
  5. Speichern Sie die Änderungen.

Nach dem Entfernen der fehlerhaften Referenz sollte die Benachrichtigung nicht mehr auftreten.

Ich hoffe, diese Schritte schaffen Klarheit. Bei weiteren Fragen helfe ich gerne weiter.

Wenn Sie meine Antwort hilfreich finden, akzeptieren Sie sie bitte als Lösung und geben Sie diesem Beitrag ein Kudos. Ihre Unterstützung wird sehr geschätzt.


Mit freundlichen Grüssen
Chris

entry.title: Issue with Subitem Breakdown in Reclassification Task S2015 (FS Item IPI_GV_M)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
I'm currently working on setting up the Reclassification Task IPI (Method S2015) in SAP Group Reporting. I've followed the standard configuration as recommended by SAP, adapting it to our client's chart of accounts.

When executing task S2015, the FS Item IPI_GV_M throws an error at sequence 010: Error G00-803 Breakdown by Subitem: Default value not permitted

I've reviewed the Breakdown Category (BDC) configuration, and it aligns with SAP's Best Practices. I’ve also tested data loads both with and without the Subitem, but the error still occurs.

Has anyone encountered this issue before or have any suggestions on what might be causing it?

Thanks in advance! SAP S/4HANA Finance for group reporting

entry.title: Re: How to order in a SAC chart without displaying the or...
entry.content:
Hi @oliver_raths 

Thank you for the question.

To achieve descending order based on the current posting period while only displaying the posting period (not the sorting field) in the SAC story chart, I suggest you follow this approach:

  • Use the custom dimension PP Sorted as the Sort By field.
  • In the chart configuration, display only the Posting Period dimension and not the PP Sorted.
  • Make sure that PP Sorted is set to Sort Descending in the chart builder.

Those steps will enable the chart to be sorted based on your designed custom logic but the viewer only sees the posting periods on the axis.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris
